===Overview===
The '''Macedonian Empire''' was founded by the ancient Kingdom of [[Macedonia]].{{r|X-Men: The Search for Cyclops #1}}

===Events===
[[Alexander of Macedon (Earth-616)|Alexander the Great]] was born the heir to the King of [[Macedonia]]. He became a king himself, establishing a great empire.{{r|Incredible Hulk #457}}

Later along with [[Mormo (Earth-616)|Lord Mormo]] of the [[Hydra (Earth-616)|Order of the Hydra]], he paid half his treasury to purchase the [[Spear of Achilles]], his ancestor.{{r|Captain America: Hail Hydra #2}}

In 330 B.C., as Alexander and his armies fought alongside the [[Nile]] River to liberate the region from the [[Persian Empire]]. This battle was witnessed by the eternal mutant known as [[En Sabah Nur (Earth-616)|Apocalypse]], who chastised his people for siding with one conqueror to defeat another, considering it a weakness.{{r|X-Men: The Search for Cyclops #1}} Following his victory and conquest of Egypt, Alexander sought to establish himself as a God among the people, as an oracle had stated that [[Zeus Panhellenios (Earth-616)|Zeus]] was the preeminent god and that himself would be a god upon his death. Learning that Apocalypse was worshiped as a god as well, Alexander brought an army to the domain of the undying mutant. When Apocalypse heard Alexander's claims of godhood, he merely laughed at the mortal. Such a sinister laugh this was that Alexander the Great and his armies fled.{{r|Incredible Hulk #457}}

Alexander ruled over [[Egypt]]{{r|Marvel Atlas #2|; [[Egypt]]'s entry}} and [[Iraq]]{{r|Marvel Atlas #2|; [[Iraq]]'s entry}} until his death in 323 B.C.{{r|Captain America: Hail Hydra #2}}

Upon Alexander's death, Mormo of the Order of the Hydra came to the Temple of Athena on the Acropolis of Phaselis, [[Lycia]], taking the Spear and having [[Lython (Earth-616)|Lython]], a priest who opposed him, killed.{{r|Captain America: Hail Hydra #2}}

====Fall of the Empire====
After Alexander's deaths the region fell into war and eventually lead to the rise of the [[Roman Empire]].
